lx4p

Class LXPRadioButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXPRadioButton

  • public class LXPRadioButton
extends java.lang.Object
    LXPRadioButton is a member of a LXPRadioGroup it highlights when it is moused over when clicked, it requests the RadioGroup select its station

      Methods

      void draw(processing.core.PApplet p)
      draws the radio button, showing a change when the mouse is over the button

      called from the LXPRadioGroup's mousePressed method sets the station of the group if the mouse was pressed inside this button

      • LXPRadioButton

        public LXPRadioButton(int xp,
              int yp,
              int r,
              LXPRadioGroup g)
        constructs a LXPRadioButton (called by LXPRadioGroup addButton)
        Parameters:
        xp - x location in Processing Applet window
        yp - y location in Processing Applet window
        r - radius of button's circle
        g - the LXPRadioGroup to which this button belongs

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        draws the radio button, showing a change when the mouse is over the button
        Parameters:
        p - the Processing Applet containing the button

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed()
        called from the LXPRadioGroup's mousePressed method sets the station of the group if the mouse was pressed inside this button

      • overCircle

        public static boolean overCircle(int x,
                 int y,
                 int diameter,
                 processing.core.PApplet p)
        utility function for determining if the mouse is within a circle
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of the center of the circle
        y - coordinate of the center of the circle
        diameter - of the circle
        p - the Processing Applet window tracking the mouse
        Returns:
        true if mouse is over circle
